clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical and Immunological Features of the CMV Infection Atypical Course in Immunocompetent Individuals
clinical_study.official_title: To Identify the Clinical and Immunological Features of the CMV Infection Atypical Course in Immunocompetent Individuals and to Develop Methods for the Diagnosis and Treatment of Patients in This Category

lead_sponsor.agency: The Republican Research and Practical Center for Epidemiology and Microbiology

clinical_study.source: The Republican Research and Practical Center for Epidemiology and Microbiology

brief_summary.textblock:
Current study evaluates possible correlations between the content of various cell populations, the genetic material of the virus and antibodies to it in the blood of patients and the risk of thrombosis development in patients with acute CMV infection.
–ê new method for the early detection of immunological and clinical signs of thromboembolic complications of CMV infection in immunocompetent individuals and the treatment of patients in this category will be developed.

primary_outcome.description: Thrombosis as a complication of CMV infection and its association with immune status, CMV specific T-cells count and CMV specific antibodies level

intervention.description: Determination of blood leukocyte subpopulations: myeloid suppressor cells, T-regulatory cells, T-cells according to the stages of differentiation (naive - effector - memory), activated T-cells; circulating endothelial cells
CMV specific T-cells detected by flow cytometry
serum CMV IgM / IgG antibodies detected by ELISA

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age 18 - 80 years;
- fever of not clear etiology
- confirmed CMV infection
Exclusion Criteria:
- HIV infection
- taking hormones, cytostatics;
- drug addiction
- malignant neoplasms over the past 5 years.
- active viral hepatitis or liver cirrhosis;
- immunosuppressive conditions of any etiology
